children.subject: I've never used them but there is software like Interfolio that holds onto your letters of rec so that you don't have to ask your recommender to send the same letter to multiple places, you just pay to have them resent.
<md>My impression is there is not and letter writers just need to upload letters to a bunch of different apps.</md>

history.content:
If you're asking about how to ask instructors for letters of rec, I wouldn't recommend asking them by e-mail. They are being inundated with e-mail right now and may not receive your request, and when they do, they may or may not remember who you are. I think you really need to manage a face to face (virtually) to see a faculty member to ask them for a letter. Hopefully you're choosing someone who will remember you when they see you. So go to their office hours and wait in whatever kind of line there is, and then maybe you can make an appointment to speak at a different time.

I know that things are different now, but in some ways they aren't. If you want to go to grad school, you need to be patient and persistent and stubborn (but not in a way that will annoy faculty, so emphasis on patient). Put yourself in their shoes and remember how overloaded with all kinds of requests they are right now, but know that they also do want to help students get into grad school this year.

children.subject: Some graduate programs specify that they won't accept letters from letter services (like Interfolio), so you should check the guidelines or ask the program for more information. I didn't use a letter service but filled out the recommender info for all programs I was applying to at once, so at least the emails weren't scattered when sent directly to the recommender

history.content: Hi, I was wondering what the best way to send requests for letters of rec would be. I am concerned that for the numerous different applications I'll have to fill out that the people I'm requesting from will be flooded by emails. Is there a better way to do all this?
history.subject: Letters of Recommendation for Grad School
